alert.note: Alert for Bienville; Bossier; Caddo; Claiborne; De Soto; Natchitoches; Red River; Webster (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 11:04AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN WEBSTER...DE SOTO...RED RIVER...NORTHERN NATCHITOCHES...SOUTHERN CADDO...SOUTH CENTRAL CLAIBORNE...BIENVILLE AND SOUTHERN BOSSIER PARISHES THROUGH 1145 AM CDT... At 1104 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Arcadia to 7 miles southeast of Heflin to Shreveport. Movement was south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Minden, Mansfield, Haughton, Greenwood, Arcadia, Blanchard, Coushatta, Stonewall, Logansport, Ringgold, Sibley, Campti, Gibsland, Doyline, Dubberly, Dixie Inn, Heflin, and Eastwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Bienville; Bossier; Caddo; Claiborne; De Soto; Natchitoches; Red River; Webster
